chapter.title: Widgets
chapter.para: The Widgets window provides access to a summary of all the system's information from a single location. This window may be configured for each user and is designed to remain active at all times in a control monitor.
It can be accessed by clicking on the Widgets tab.
The first time a user accesses it, it will appear empty as long as no widgets have been created.

Widgets may be added by clicking on the "Add Widget" tab. To the right there is the option to boost all data reload and a countdown clock indicating the time remaining for them to be downloaded automatically (if activated). This option can be activated by clicking on "More Options."
A dialogue box will appear requesting the following information:

listitem.para: Name.- Unique name for the widget.
Description.- A loose description of the widget.
Attribute.- The value we want to display: Origin IP, Destination IP, Protocol, Sensor, Signature, Severity and Map.
Graph type.- Lastly, the timeframe for the data to be displayed should be entered: last 24 hours, week, last month, quarter or year.

chapter.para: Once several widgets have been created, the window will roughly look like this:
Moving the cursor to the bottom of each widget will bring up a "Load more..." chart for expanding the data set from which the information was obtained.
Moving the cursor to the upper right hand corner of the widget will cause the following icons to be displayed:

listitem.para: Minimise.- Hides the widget or moves it to the background.
Reload.- Forces the widget's data to be reloaded individually.
Edit.- To edit the widget's configuration parameters.
